title: Statistics Essentials for Data Science
content:
Module 3, Lesson 2: Statistics Essentials for Data Science

The Hook

Statistics is the mathematical language of data science. Without statistical foundations, a data scientist cannot validate whether patterns are real or random noise.

The Concept

1. Descriptive statistics (mean, median, std dev)

Understanding Descriptive statistics (mean, median, std dev) is foundational to this topic. Indian companies and research institutions apply these principles in production AI systems every day.

2. Probability distributions (normal, Poisson, binomial)

Probability distributions (normal, Poisson, binomial) forms the core methodology for practitioners. India's tech ecosystem from Bengaluru to Hyderabad deploys these approaches at scale.

3. Hypothesis testing and p-values

Hypothesis testing and p-values is critical for building reliable AI solutions. Top Indian firms like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and startups like Razorpay all leverage these techniques.

4. Correlation vs causation and sampling bias

Mastering Correlation vs causation and sampling bias separates good practitioners from great ones. Apply these concepts on Indian open datasets from data.gov.in to build hands-on expertise.

The Illustration

This lesson covered Descriptive statistics (mean, median, std dev), Probability distributions (normal, Poisson, binomial), Hypothesis testing and p-values, and Correlation vs causation and sampling bias. These are the building blocks of statistics essentials for data science â€” master them through practice on real Indian datasets.

quiz.question: Which measure of central tendency is most robust to outliers?
What does a p-value represent?
options: The probability of observing the data if the null hypothesis were true

quiz.question: What does "correlation does not imply causation" mean?
options: Correlated variables cannot be predicted from each other
Two variables can be correlated without one causing the other

quiz.question: Which distribution models rare events over time?
What is survivorship bias?
options: Bias from selecting only surviving entities while ignoring failures
